item.title: Private cloud based on openSUSE Leap 15.3 beta and Nextcloud
item.author: zoltan.balogh@suse.com (l3mnt2010 Balogh)
item.description: Motivation I used to have a Synology DS414 server what worked well for about 8 years. Naturally, occasionally I had to change disks in the RAID5 system in it, but other than that it did its job. But regardless of the really smooth user experience and the low maintenance needs I never really liked that system as the Synology Disk Station Manager OS is not like many “real” Linux distributions and the community behind that OS is basically non existent.
